title: Solnohu
text:
Solnohu or Sol Nohu, also known as Solnoho, Solnahu and Solnahou, is a small crescent-shaped <a href="uninhabited%20island">uninhabited island</a> in the <a href="Rotuma%20Group">Rotuma Group</a> of <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>. The island is of special importance in <a href="Rotumans">Rotuman</a> and <a href="Demographics%20of%20Tonga">Tongan</a> <a href="funerary">funerary</a> customs.
Geography.
Solnohu is the fourth largest island in the Rotuma Group of sixteen <a href="volcanic%20island">volcanic island</a>s located 646 kilometres (401 mi) north of Fiji. It has an area of 9.6 hectares and lies approximately 70 meters away from the southern district of <a href="Juju%20%28district%29">Juju</a> on the main island of <a href="Rotuma">Rotuma</a>, but it is still within the <a href="fringing%20reef">fringing reef</a>. The island is also one of two outliers to the south of Rotuma, the other being <a href="Solkope">Solkope</a>.
Climate.
The <a href="climate">climate</a> in the area is <a href="temperate">temperate</a>. The average annual temperature is 20 <a href="%C2%B0C">°C</a>. The warmest month is March, when the average temperature is 26 °C, and the coldest is December, with 0 °C. The average annual rainfall is 3,420 millimeters. The wettest month is February, with an average of 504 mm of <a href="precipitation">precipitation</a>, and the driest is September, with 195 mm of precipitation.
Flora and fauna.
Some of the <a href="flora">flora</a> common to the island are the "<a href="Epipremnum%20pinnatum">Epipremnum pinnatum</a>", a species of <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a> in the <a href="Araceae">Araceae</a> family and the "<a href="Merremia%20peltata">Merremia peltata</a>", a species of flowering <a href="vine">vine</a> in the <a href="Convolvulaceae">Convolvulaceae</a> family.
Solnohu is also part of the Rotuma <a href="Important%20Bird%20Area">Important Bird Area</a> (IBA) which consists of the main island of Rotuma and associated small satellite islets.
Mythology.
One of the island's known <a href="legend">legend</a>s is that of "The turtle of Sol Onau" (or Sol Onah, both being alternative spellings of Sol Nohu). The legend tells of two girls who slip from a flat rock platform at the top of the island and fell to the sea. The girls did not die but were instead changed into two immortal <a href="sea%20turtle">sea turtle</a>s, one red and one white. They are said to live in the <a href="coral">coral</a> under the rock, and can be called up at any time by singing an <a href="incantation">incantation</a>.
